This game has the best ideas behind it, and I really appreciate that Toby Fox is a better storyteller than Hussie.   !! SPOILERS !!   What's interesting is that pretty much every character is written as a character. Except Flowey, who's written as if it was also a player, just like you.  Papyrus is a failure that is lying to himself. He doesn't do anything else except putting you in the friend-zone. (seriously Pap', the only accurate thing you say in the entire game is 'I don't really love you'. That's awful.)   Undyne is clearly a violent but naive royal guard .  And that is because Alphys is also a weeaboo that is lying to herself and everybody else too.  Mettaton is a ghost that abandoned all his family and friends to live inside a robot only for entertaining these 9 viewers on television. Isn't that sad ? ((by the way, who made that gay-anime-style robot ? Of course, it's Alphys. Man, she's really frustrated.))  Napstablook is depressed. But hey, is that really a family tradition ? Ghosts are so annoying in this game.  Also, Mad Dummy, it's a ghost that lives inside a dummy and wants to become incorporeal. Like, in a DUMMY. That sucks sooo much. Also, if this ghost spares you it's because you killed everyone. Basically, the ghost's hatred for you is so intense that he becomes incorporeal. After that, he is HAPPY about all this because being incorporeal was his life-long dream. Nice character representating nowadays' egoism. ((or should I say individualism ? ;)))  LET'S GET TO THE REAL IMPORTANT CHARACTERS. Like, the ones with a ♥♥♥♥ing background, please.  SANS : I'll write about this one first. This character is EMPTY. Yeah. Empty. I just know that it's a skeleton that likes awful puns and knows everything about the player dying and restarting. That's basically mr-fourth-wall-man. Get it ? It's funny because you're the one that broke him. Actually, there might be more. Sans's background is the most interesting thing. Like, all these theories about time travel, and SANS IS NESS, and gaster stuff. But this is not canon. So I won't talk about this here. I'll update when Toby will make him an actual background.   TORIEL : lol deviantart is full of her. The fandom really does suck. Basically, she's the second worst character. (after Papyrus because she's actually useful in the story) She's not even a good mother. She lost NINE CHILDREN in her life ((Chara, Asriel, the six other children, and mainly, YOU)). I like to think that she said the same thing to every human child after Chara, because I clearly can't think she's not strong enough to protect children.   She just let the player past her. She prefered to leave the trone and try to keep the humans in the most boring area of the underground than actually stay with Asgore and stop him from killing them.  It's not like Asgore is that kind of husband that was threatening or anything...SO WHY DID SHE LEAVE ?! NICE JOB GOATMOM.   ASGORE : Is that another character that was lying to everybody ?? Man, no wonder why Alphys seemed to love him. He's a ♥♥♥♥ing muscular beast that doesn't want to change things. He lost two children too ((well obviously, because he's goatdad)) and lied to the whole underground.  ((except his wife because he didn't have to : she just locked herself in the ruins))  I kinda like this character. He wanted to take his responsibilities. He's the king, so he couldn't just run away and let everyone forget about him like a disgusting monster. ((right toriel ?)) He just didn't know that seven ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ children would actually fall in a giant hole as if they wanted to die ???   ASRIEL : If Papyrus is the number one worst character, Asriel might be the number zero. 'mr-drama-man' So, humans and monsters are ENEMIES, right ? So why would you go to the surface with a ♥♥♥♥ing human corpse in your hands ???!!! That's provocation. And Chara knew it. But Asriel didn't expect a single thing. He died without helping anyone, too. Neither Chara nor the monsters. And that's how the drama started. That's why Asgore had to make something quick, he didn't have the choice. The monsters were desperate, so he declared war and promised the monsters to free them all. That's actually not a bad decision. I mean, are the humans really worth it ? They probably can't even help themselves. So, at the final boss of the pacifist, what ACTUALLY happens ?  Flowey absorbs all the souls. Including Asriel's. Since Flowey's the result of a really crappy experience, ((I wonder who made this mess)) we learn he is actually Asriel's essence, but WITHOUT Asriel's soul. So as soon as he gets his soul back, he IS Asriel, right ?  Asriel with all his kindness. Yeah, he's the powerful monster that wants to kill you at the end. Yeah, he's the powerful monster you want to save. Save ? From WHAT ? Becoming Flowey again ? Look, he's not Flowey anymore. He's ASRIEL. But, he still wants that power. Reseting and stuff. He still wants to murder you. And when you beat him, oh look, he becomes nice !  I hate this character so much. He doesn't make any sense.  And his 'god of hyperdeath' stuff is cringy, too. It's not because he's a child that he's so cute and nice. He's not stable. He doesn't know what he's doing. He wants to restart everything over and over again. So edgy.  The player survives just because this boss doesn't make any sense. You just can't die. That's it. Ruining all the intensity of the fight in one sentence. 'But it refused'. Well done.  Sooo. Who's left ?   FLOWEY : The only character that made me replay thrice that game. What's interesting is that it's actually the ONLY character that knows it's in a game, not like Sans that talks about really scientific stuff like timelines and time travel. Flowey is actually a player too. While he gets the most hate from the fanbase, he's the character that's the most like the player. He made way more good in the underground than the player, and eventually he got bored and made way more evil in the underground than the player. I just wanted a post-genocide route where he could not do the exact same thing. After all, isn't he supposed to remember everything ? So why wouldn't he come back to Frisk before he becomes evil ? Again, even the most interesting character has holes in it, and that's too bad. He feels emotions like love and fear for Chara in the end of the genocide route. That's weird, because he says himself that he can't feel anything because he lost his soul.   But hey, Photoshop Flowey is the best final boss I've played in my entire life. Photoshop Flowey is the best thing about Undertale.   CHARA : well that's the most confusing character in the game. It's like Toby wanted to make a meta character representing the player playing Undertale as if it were a classic rpg but then decided to give it an actual background in the story. That's really weird. Why does the player name an existing character that already made his actions in the story way before the character that you actually play falls in the underground ??  That doesn't make much sense.     GASTER : he's interesting only because he doesn't exist    JERRY: reminds me that this game has this 'S H l T P O S T' vibe  ______________________________________________________________  oh, and also, yes, please note that there's a linear player evolution to Undertale.  It goes like this :  NEUTRAL => PACIFIST => GENOCIDE  Every blind player started with the Neutral route. Then made the Pacifist route. And eventually, finished playing this game after completing the Genocide route.  The Pacifist ending isn't the 'True ending'. Because even if the player stops playing after the pacifist, he'll always launch the game at least once again and see there's still something happening after the second true reset.  The third and final true reset, leading to the genocide. that's the storyline, deal with it :^)

I've put enough hours into Undertale and I can definitely recommend this game. I like the direction Toby Fox took with an RPG where you don't have to kill anyone, but still left the option open for the class RPG players. The music is amazing, probably one of the best I've personally ever heard. The characters are easy to get attached to and the fact that most of them are silly in their own way puts more emphasis on Genocide route, because you will likely feel sad about it. Overall it's one of my favorite games ever.

I waited too long to write this. (I also realized there were some grammatical mistakes that misconstrued my point, so I apologize if you were put off by my original review.) Personally, I absolutely love this game. However, like most sane people, I really disliek the fanbase, for obvious reasons you can find with a quick Google/Bing Images search of the game. However, I am not afraid to admit. This is not a game that absolutely everyone should adore and if you don't, then you're not a maniac that should be locked up. I love good stories in video games, and this is personally my favorite story I have ever come across in video games. Now, I'm not saying all other games' stories are horrible, I just enjoy this one the most. However, if you are an FPS-genre fan that cares a lot about graphics, and gameplay (Again, not insulting you, it's what you like, do as you please.), then you will most likely dislike this game. Thank you for reading this, I hope you enjoyed my input.

What can I say that hasn't neen said already? Undertale is an impressive empathy game. Gameplay wise it isn't the most compelling game. Yet you can't help but fall in love with the cast of colourful and fleshed out characters. If the game hasn't already been spoiled for you it is certainly worth its price. You'll find replay value in discovering the different ways you can influence the game. If you enjoy story centric games you'll like Undertale.

I liked this game and I recommend it. I'm not really crazy about it like most people but I found the story and gameplay to be very good. I've sadly spoiled myself about everything in this game but even though I have I still found it to be enjoyable. The fact that this game allows you to play through it without killing one creature is something I personally think is innovative and refreshing. In an RPG you usually are supposed to kill everyone and gain levels but in Undertale you don't have to and you actually have a choice. So yeah. I thought the game was good. The only thing wrong with the game is that the graphics and sprites aren't always appealing. When I talk about the sprites I mean the ones that are outside of battle. The ones in battle are impressive even though they don't have color. Some areas like the ruins are very lacking in detail. But honestly that doesn't matter a lot. This game is good. The real big problem is that a lot of people in the fanbase are very annoying. Trust me. Anyways, be awesome everyone!
